name: CreateEnterpriseScimGroup
description:
Create a SCIM group for a GitHub enterprise account.

Facilitates the creation of a SCIM group within a GitHub enterprise. This tool should be used when you need to establish a new group with optional member inclusion. Any specified members will be added as external group members, and it's important to maintain mapping of their identifiers.

parameters.name: enterprise_scim_group_details
parameters.description: A JSON object containing group details: `displayName`, `externalId`, `members` (optional), and `schemas`. `members` is an array with `displayName` and `value` for each member.

displayName.description: A human-readable name for a security group.

externalId.description: A unique identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client.

displayName.description: The display name associated with the member

value.description: The local unique identifier for the member

schemas.description: The URIs that are used to indicate the namespaces of the SCIM schemas.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

displayName.description: A human-readable name for a security group.

externalId.description: A unique identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client.

displayName.description: The display name associated with the member

value.description: The local unique identifier for the member

schemas.description: The URIs that are used to indicate the namespaces of the SCIM schemas.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
